DOC.brief_summary: Sepsis related to the development of cardiac complications. However, the investigators understanding regarding this condition remains incomplete. Possible explanations raised include coronary perfusion decrease, activation of the coagulation system and release of inflammatory mediators, including endotoxins, cytokines and others. In this study the investigators wanted to examine the impact of any infectious disease, (not necessarily Pneumonia), on the QT interval in patients hospitalized for acute infectious disease.
DOC.brief_title: The Impact of Infectious Disease on QT Segment
DOC.criteria: Internal ward hospitalized patient, due to illness which its etiology is bacterial, fungal or viral Can not technically perform reliably ECG (amputated legs, lack of cooperation, etc.) Subject with permanent pacemaker
